title: Mexican Street Corn Salad Recipe
description: This Mexican corn salad made with canned corn, butter, mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder, and lime has all the flavors of elote.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Salads Mexican Street Corn Salad 4.7 (82) 62 Reviews 20 Photos This Mexican corn salad combines hot canned corn with butter, mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder, and lime for a delicious savory treat that reminds me of elotes (Mexican grilled corn on the cob) that I always enjoyed at Cinco de Mayo fiestas in southern California. Submitted by Parizienne Updated on September 27, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 20 20 20 20 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 (15.25 ounce) cans whole kernel corn, undrained ¼ cup grated cotija cheese 2 tablespoons mayonnaise 1 tablespoon butter 1 pinch red chili powder to taste 2 tablespoons lime juice, or to taste 1 sprig cilantro for garnish Directions Pour corn with liquid into a saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat and simmer until hot. Drain well, and return to the saucepan. Stir in cotija cheese, mayonnaise, and butter. Season to taste with red chili powder and lime juice. Spoon into a serving dish, and garnish with a sprig of cilantro to serve. Cook’s Note You can grate Cotija or you can dice it. I prefer the grated because it doesn't overpower the corn. I Made It Print 176 home cooks made it! Made this with enchiladas as a side salad and it was a big hit! 05 of 20 Photo by  Annie Patterson 10/07/2020 06 of 20 Photo by  Kris Shelley 08/17/2020 07 of 20 Photo by  Tingting Li 07/21/2020 08 of 20 Photo by  Heidi Maines 05/30/2020 09 of 20 Photo by  shegypsy 03/10/2020 10 of 20 Photo by  MsCochran 11/28/2019 The only way I plan to cook corn from here on out! This was a surprise addition to our holiday dinner and this gained 10’s across the board. That Lime taste kicks in and turns the party up in your mouth. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Elote Salad 33 Ratings Spicy Mexican Street Corn Salad 2 Ratings Mexican Street Corn-Chicken Salad 1 Rating Mexican Corn-off-the-Cob Salad 10 Ratings Mexican Blackened Corn 81 Ratings Elotes (Mexican Corn in a Cup) 12 Ratings Corn Salad with Lime Vinaigrette 40 Ratings Mexican Corn on the Cob (Elote) 365 Ratings Corn, Sweet Onion, and Tomato Salad 66 Ratings Easy Corn Salad — Great Side for BBQs 20 Ratings Anytime Canned Corn Salad 45 Ratings Corn Casserole with Cauliflower 1 Rating Okonomilotes Corn Salad 54 Ratings Cilantro Tomato Corn Salad 171 Ratings Shoepeg Corn Salad 59 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Parizienne
instructions: Pour corn with liquid into a saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat and simmer until hot. Drain well, and return to the saucepan.;Stir in cotija cheese, mayonnaise, and butter. Season to taste with red chili powder and lime juice. Spoon into a serving dish, and garnish with a sprig of cilantro to serve.
